p: Atherosclerosis is characterized by the accumulation of thrombus, cells or lipids plaques within the arterial intima [ 72]. The activation of vascular smooth muscle cells (VSMC) is a major contributor to atherosclerosis and generates ROS. Increased ROS promotes acute inflammatory responses and subsequent vasculature dysfunction in atherosclerotic lesions [ 73]. Therefore, inhibiting or blocking the activation or proliferation of VSMC has proven to be a rational approach in the treatment of atherosclerosis [ 74].
